question: Under electrostatic condition of a charged conductor, which among the following statements is true?
choices: The electric field on the surface of a charged conductor is <katex>$\frac{\sigma}{2\epsilon_{0}}$</katex> where <katex>$\sigma$</katex> is the surface charge density
The electric potential inside a charged conductor is always zero
Any excess charge resides on the surface of the conductor
The net electric field is tangential to the surface of the conductor
explanation: In electrostatics, any excess charge placed on a conductor moves to its exterior surface.
Field is <katex>$\sigma/\epsilon_0$</katex> (not /2), potential is constant (not zero), and field is normal (not tangential).
